page.title: 03ECOLOGY - CLAXBY/USSELBY
page.content: Being a predominantly agricultural area there is little obvious industrial pollution although some concern has been expressed over the emissions from the power stations in the Trent Valley 25 miles away. There are a wide range of wild flowers and plants growing in the area as well as wild animals. In general local farmers maintain hedges and woodland well and there appears to be an awareness of the importance of conservation with the exception of the Viking Way footpath the others in the area are little used and poorly kept. The major part of the territory is sheltered from northerly and easterly winds by the Lincolnshire wolds. There is often a marked difference in temperature between the lowland areas and the more exposed higher land.
